The potential drug–disease interactions in patients with COVID-19 have become a highly researched topic
12– 14 (Fig. 2). First, whether antihypertensive agents such as ACE inhibitors and angiotensin II receptor blockers (ARBs) are involved in the progression or prevention of COVID-19 is unknown
113, 119 . Second, some of the potential antiviral drugs used to treat patients with COVID-19 are known to induce cardiotoxicity
41 .
